intro: Praravinia mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao praravinia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
